column4: I can connect to the router and the DHCP recognises me whenver I have encryption turned off. The second I turn on WEP, I put in the key, and it won't work.
Make sure you install on the empty partition and all is well.
So has anyone managed to get a wireless network working on Dapper with 128bit WEP?
when you put in the key, try using "s:" in front; so if "password" is your key, try typing "s:password"
that is of course if you're using a text key, which it sounds like you're not
have you tried using iwconfig from the terminal?
many times. I'm not sure whether I did it right though.
'sudo iwconfig eth1 essid the-name-of-your-access-point key your-wep-key
the above command usually does the trick for me
On my router, I set the key by typing in a word, hit generate and it makes a hex string.
not sure, but I think you'd need to put in the hex string
but you could try 'sudo iwconfig eth1 essid the-name-of-your-access-point key s:the-word-you-used' which is faster
no luck
too bad :(
you say that if you turn off wep, it works fine?
in my router setup, I can choose to use ASCII or HEX mode encryption - if you have that option, try changing it?
my understanding is that you should use the alternative cd for upgrades (rather than the live CD)
easiest though is to upgrade via the Internet
isn't the numbers in the corners the numbers you press on the numpad while holding ALT to get that character?
could be... any idea how to get them to display as characters instead?
NOt a clue.
:) too bad. does it display as a block on your screen or is there actually a character there?
block, i think.
Oh, I'm in windows at the moment, so it's just a black square.
